member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.MemoryManagement
member.summary: This class is used for general memory management of CE-based devices

member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of allocated memory for Storage, in kilobytes

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.MemoryManagement.SystemProgramMemory
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of allocated memory for Programs, in kilobytes

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.MemoryManagement.MemoryLoad
member.summary: Specifies a number between zero and 100 that gives a general idea of current memory utilization, in which zero indicates no memory use and 100 indicates full memory use.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.MemoryManagement.TotalPhysicalMemory
member.summary: Indicates the total number of bytes of physical memory.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.MemoryManagement.TotalVirtualMemory
member.summary: Indicates the total number of bytes that can be described in the user mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.MemoryManagement.AvailablePhysicalMemory
member.summary: Indicates the number of bytes of physical memory available.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.MemoryManagement.AvailableVirtualMemory
member.summary: Indicates the number of bytes of unreserved and uncommitted memory in the user mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

member.summary: Hard-resets the device. Use with caution.

member.summary: Suspends the device (puts it into sleep mode)

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.PowerManagement.SetIdleState
member.summary: Forces the device into Idle state. For many devices, this will power down the backlight.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.PowerManagement.SetOnState
member.summary: Forces the device into On state. Useful for forcing a suspended device to stay on

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.PowerManagement.ResetSystemIdleTimer
member.summary: Resets the system inactivity timer, preventing it from entering Idle state

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceStatusMonitor
member.summary: Class for receiving device notifications of all sorts (storage card insertions/removals, etc.) When a change is detected, an event is fired to all interested parties. The parameters of the event indicate the GUID of the device interface that changed, whether the device is now connected or disconnected from the system, and the name of the device (COM1:, for example), which changed.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceStatusMonitor.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor for DeviceStatusMonitor. Specifies the class of notifications desired and whether notifications should be fired for already-attached devices.
member.param: GUID of device class to monitor (or Guid.Empty to monitor *all* device notifications).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceStatusMonitor.#ctor(OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceClass,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor for DeviceStatusMonitor. Specifies the class of notifications desired and whether notifications should be fired for already-attached devices.
member.param: Device class to monitor.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceStatusMonitor.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor stops status monitoring.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceStatusMonitor.StopStatusMonitoring
member.summary: Stops the worker thread which monitors for changes of status of the adapter. This must be done, if monitoring has been started, before the object is destroyed.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceStatusMonitor.StartStatusMonitoring
member.summary: Initiates a worker thread to listen for reports of device changes. Listeners can register for notification of these changes, which the thread will send.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceStatusMonitor.OnDeviceNotification(OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceNotificationArgs)
member.summary: Raises the DeviceNotification event.
member.param: An EventArgs that contains the event data.

TimeSpan from Now for the event to be set

member.summary: Creates a new user notification.
member.param: String that specifies the name of the application that owns this notification.
The time when the notification should occur.
Notification object that describes the events that are to occur when the notification time is reached.
member.returns: The handle to the notification indicates success.

member.summary: Edit an existing user notification.
member.param: Handle to the notification to overwrite.
String that specifies the name of the application that owns this notification.
The time when the notification should occur.
Notification object that describes the events that are to occur when the notification time is reached.
member.returns: The handle to the notification indicates success.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.Notify.SetUserNotification(OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotificationTrigger,OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotification)
member.summary: This function creates a new user notification.
member.param: A UserNotificationTrigger that defines what event activates a notification.
A UserNotification that defines how the system should respond when a notification occurs.
member.returns: Handle to the notification event if successful.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.Notify.SetUserNotification(System.Int32,OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotificationTrigger,OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotification)
member.summary: This function modifies an existing user notification.
member.param: Handle of the Notification to be modified
A UserNotificationTrigger that defines what event activates a notification.
A UserNotification that defines how the system should respond when a notification occurs.
member.returns: Handle to the notification event if successful.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.Notify.ClearUserNotification(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a registered user notification that was created by a previous call to the SetUserNotification function.
member.param: Handle to the user notification to delete.
member.returns: TRUE indicates success. FALSE indicates failure.
member.remarks: ClearNotification does not operate on notifications that have occurred.

member.summary: Retrieves notification information associated with a handle.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.Notify.GetUserNotificationHandles
member.summary: Returns an array of currently stored notifications.

member.summary: This function queries the user for notification settings by displaying a dialog box showing options that are valid for the current hardware platform.
member.param: Handle to the parent window for the notification settings dialog box.
member.returns: A UserNotification structure containing the user's notification settings.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.Notify.GetUserNotificationPreferences(System.IntPtr,OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotification)
member.summary: This function queries the user for notification settings by displaying a dialog box showing options that are valid for the current hardware platform.
member.param: Handle to the parent window for the notification settings dialog box.
UserNotification structure used to populate the default settings.
member.returns: A UserNotification structure containing the user's notification settings.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.Notify.HandleAppNotifications(System.String)
member.summary: This function marks as "handled" all notifications previously registered by the given application that have occurred.
member.param: The name of the application whose events are to be marked as "handled". This must be the name that was passed in to as the owner of the notification.

member.summary: Returns the raw structure in a .
member.returns: Byte array containing the SYSTEMTIME data.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.op_Implicit(OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation)~System.Byte[]
member.summary: Provides a native-code supported byte array representation of a TimeZoneInformation

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.op_Implicit(System.Byte[])~OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation
member.summary: Creates a TimeZoneInformation instance from a byte array representation

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.DisplayName
member.summary: Name used to describe the Time Zone.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.Bias
member.summary: Specifies the current bias, in minutes, for local time translation on this computer.
member.remarks:
The bias is the difference, in minutes, between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time. All translations between UTC and local time are based on the following formula:
UTC = local time + bias

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.StandardName
member.summary: Name associated with standard time on this device.
member.remarks: For example, this member could contain “EST” to indicate Eastern Standard Time.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.StandardDate
member.summary: The date and local time when the transition from Daylight time to Standard time occurs.
member.remarks:
This member supports two date formats. Absolute format specifies an exact date and time when standard time begins. In this form, the wYear, wMonth, wDay, wHour, wMinute, wSecond, and wMilliseconds members of the SYSTEMTIME structure are used to specify an exact date.
Day-in-month format is specified by setting the wYear member to zero, setting the wDayOfWeek member to an appropriate weekday, and using a wDay value in the range 1 through 5 to select the correct day in the month. Using this notation, the first Sunday in April can be specified, as can the last Thursday in October (5 is equal to “the last”).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.StandardBias
member.summary: Specifies a bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during standard time.
member.remarks: This member is ignored if a value for the StandardDate member is not supplied. This value is added to the value of the Bias member to form the bias used during standard time. In most time zones, the value of this member is zero.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.DaylightName
member.summary: Specifies a string associated with daylight time.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.DaylightDate
member.summary: Specifies a date and local time when the transition from standard time to daylight time occurs.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneInformation.DaylightBias
member.summary: Specifies a bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during daylight time.

member.summary: This structure contains information about current memory availability. The GlobalMemoryStatus function uses this structure.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.NativeMethods.MemoryStatus.MemoryLoad
member.summary: Specifies a number between 0 and 100 that gives a general idea of current memory utilization, in which 0 indicates no memory use and 100 indicates full memory use.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.NativeMethods.MemoryStatus.TotalPhysical
member.summary: Indicates the total number of bytes of physical memory.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.NativeMethods.MemoryStatus.AvailablePhysical
member.summary: Indicates the number of bytes of physical memory available.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.NativeMethods.MemoryStatus.TotalPageFile
member.summary: Indicates the total number of bytes that can be stored in the paging file. Note that this number does not represent the actual physical size of the paging file on disk.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.NativeMethods.MemoryStatus.AvailablePageFile
member.summary: Indicates the number of bytes available in the paging file.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.NativeMethods.MemoryStatus.TotalVirtual
member.summary: Indicates the total number of bytes that can be described in the user mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.NativeMethods.MemoryStatus.AvailableVirtual
member.summary: Indicates the number of bytes of unreserved and uncommitted memory in the user mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneCollection
member.summary: Define a TimeZoneCollection which can return a list of all of the TimeZones known to the OS. This should help make time zone picker controls, etc.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneCollection.ALL_TIMEZONES_LIST
member.summary: All timezones

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of TimeZoneCollection

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneCollection.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the contents of the TimeZoneCollection

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneCollection.Initialize
member.summary: The Initialize() method is equivalent to calling Initialize( ALL_TIMEZONES_LIST ). It populates the collection with all OS-known timezones.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneCollection.Initialize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use the Initialize method with the gmtOffset parameter to create a list of timezones which have a specific offset value. For example, for all timezones at GMT-5:00, pass -300 (minutes). To get all of the time zones known to the OS, pass ALL_TIMEZONES_LIST or call the method with no parameters.
member.param: Offset of the target timezones from GMT (in minutes).

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo
member.summary: This structure contains information about the current computer system. This includes the processor type, page size, memory addresses, and OEM identifier.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.ProcessorArchitecture
member.summary: The system's processor architecture.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.PageSize
member.summary: The page size and the granularity of page protection and commitment.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.MinimumApplicationAddress
member.summary: Pointer to the lowest memory address accessible to applications and dynamic-link libraries (DLLs).

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.MaximumApplicationAddress
member.summary: Pointer to the highest memory address accessible to applications and DLLs.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.ActiveProcessorMask
member.summary: Specifies a mask representing the set of processors configured into the system. Bit 0 is processor 0; bit 31 is processor 31.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.NumberOfProcessors
member.summary: Specifies the number of processors in the system.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.ProcessorType
member.summary: Specifies the type of processor in the system.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.AllocationGranularity
member.summary: Specifies the granularity with which virtual memory is allocated.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.ProcessorLevel
member.summary: Specifies the system’s architecture-dependent processor level.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemInfo.ProcessorRevision
member.summary: Specifies an architecture-dependent processor revision.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceNotification
member.summary: Delegate for device notification events

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement
member.summary: This class provides access to common device management functionality

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.ShowCalibrationScreen
member.summary: Displays the device's touchpanel calibration screen

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.GetDeviceGuid
member.summary: Returns a Guid representing the unique idenitifier of the device.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.GetDeviceID
member.summary: Returns a string containing a unique identifier for the device.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.SetStdioPath(OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.StdIoStream,System.String)
member.summary: This function sets the standard input, output, or error output destination path.
member.param: Specifies the standard stream to modify
Specifies the device driver to which the output is sent. For example, "TEL1:" specifies the telnet device driver or "\MyLogFile.txt" for a text file output

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.GetStdioPath(OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.StdIoStream)
member.summary: This function retrieves the name of the device driver being used for a standard input, output, or error output operation.
member.param: The standard stream of interest
member.returns: The current path for the standard stream

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.TimeChanged

member.summary: Fired when the device timezone is changed via the UI or API

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.SystemInformation
member.summary: Returns the SystemInfo for the device

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.PlatformName
member.summary: Returns a string which identifies the device platform.
member.remarks:
Valid values include:-
PocketPCPocket PC device or Emulator
SmartPhoneSmartphone 2003 Device or Emulator
CEPC platformWindows CE.NET Emulator Additional platform types will have other names. Useful when writing library code targetted at multiple platforms.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceManagement.OemInfo
member.summary: Returns OEM specific information from the device. This may include Model number

member.summary: Create a new instance of the UserNotification class

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotification.Action
member.summary: Any combination of the members.
member.value: Flags which specifies the action(s) to be taken when the notification is triggered.
member.remarks: Flags not valid on a given hardware platform will be ignored.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotification.Title
member.summary: Required if NotificationAction.Dialog is set, ignored otherwise

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotification.Text
member.summary: Required if NotificationAction.Dialog is set, ignored otherwise.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.UserNotification.Sound
member.summary: Sound string as supplied to PlaySound.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceNotificationArgs
member.summary: DeviceNotificationArgs passed to interested parties when a device notification is fired. Contains the device class GUID, a flag indicating whether the device is attached or detached, and the device name.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceNotificationArgs.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for notification arguments.
member.param: Device class GUID
Device attached, true or false
Device name

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceNotificationArgs.DeviceInterfaceGUID
member.summary: GUID of the interface/type/class of the device being attached or detached.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceNotificationArgs.DeviceAttached
member.summary: True if, after the latest event, the device is connected; false, otherwise.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.DeviceNotificationArgs.DeviceName
member.summary: The device name being attached/detached. Might be a stream driver name like COM1:, or something more descriptive like Power Manager, depending on the GUID.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.StdIoStream

member.summary: The standard input stream (typically the console)

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.StdIoStream.Output
member.summary: The standard output stream (typically the console)

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.StdIoStream.ErrorOutput

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction
member.summary: Specifies the system-wide parameter to query or set.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetMouse
member.summary: Retrieves the two mouse threshold values and the mouse speed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetMouse
member.summary: Sets the two mouse threshold values and the mouse speed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetDeskWallpaper
member.summary: For Windows CE 2.12 and later, sets the desktop wallpaper.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetWorkArea
member.summary: Sets the size of the work area — the portion of the screen not obscured by the system taskbar or by toolbars displayed on the desktop by applications.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetWorkArea
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the work area on the primary screen.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetShowSounds
member.summary: Retrieves whether the show sounds option is on or off.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetShowSounds
member.summary: Turns the show sounds accessibility option on or off.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetWheelScrollLines
member.summary: Gets the number of lines to scroll when the mouse wheel is rotated.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetWheelScrollLines
member.summary: Sets the number of lines to scroll when the mouse wheel is rotated.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetFontSmoothingContrast
member.summary: Retrieves a contrast value that is used in smoothing text displayed using Microsoft® ClearType®.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetFontSmoothingContrast
member.summary: Sets the contrast value used when displaying text in a ClearType font.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetScreenSaveTimeout
member.summary: Retrieves the screen saver time-out value, in seconds.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetScreenSaveTimeout
member.summary: Sets the screen saver time-out value to the value of the uiParam parameter.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetBatteryIdleTimeout
member.summary: Sets the amount of time that Windows CE will stay on with battery power before it suspends due to user inaction.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetBatteryIdleTimeout
member.summary: Retrieves the amount of time that Windows CE will stay on with battery power before it suspends due to user inaction.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetExternalIdleTimeout
member.summary: Sets the amount of time that Windows CE will stay on with AC power before it suspends due to user inaction.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetExternalIdleTimeout
member.summary: Retrieves the amount of time that Windows CE will stay on with AC power before it suspends due to user inaction.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.SetWakeupIdleTimeout
member.summary: Sets the amount of time that Windows CE will stay on after a user notification that reactivates the suspended device.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetWakeupIdleTimeout
member.summary: Retrieves the amount of time that Windows CE will stay on after a user notification that reactivates a suspended device.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetPlatformType
member.summary: Get the platform name e.g. PocketPC, Smartphone etc.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoAction.GetOemInfo
member.summary: Get OEM specific information.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoFlags
member.summary: Specifies whether the user profile is to be updated, and if so, whether the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message is to be broadcast to all top-level windows to notify them of the change.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoFlags.None
member.summary: No notifications are sent on settings changed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoFlags.UpdateIniFile
member.summary: Writes the new system-wide parameter setting to the user profile.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.SystemParametersInfoFlags.SendChange
member.summary: Broadcasts the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message after updating the user profile.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneState
member.summary: Return values from .

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneState.Unknown
member.summary: The system cannot determine the current time zone. This value is returned if daylight savings time is not used in the current time zone, because there are no transition dates.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneState.Standard
member.summary: The system is operating in the range covered by the StandardDate member of the structure.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.TimeZoneState.Daylight
member.summary: The system is operating in the range covered by the DaylightDate member of the structure.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine
member.summary: Strings passed on the command line when an event occurs that the app has requested via CeRunAppAtEvent.
member.remarks: Note that some of these strings will be used as the command line *prefix*, since the rest of the command line will be used as a parameter.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtTime
member.summary: String passed on the command line when an app is run as the result of a call to .

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunToHandleNotification
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application that "owns" a notification. It is followed by a space, and the stringized version of the notification handle.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAfterTimeChange
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when the system time settings are changed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAfterSync
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application after synchronisation.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtAcPowerOn
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when the device is connected to AC power.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtAcPowerOff
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when the AC power is disconnected.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtNetConnect
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when the device connects to a LAN.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtNetDisconnect
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when the device disconnects from a LAN.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtDeviceChange
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application that "owns" a notification. It is followed by a space, and the stringized version of the notification handle.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtIrDiscovery
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when another device is discovered using IR.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAtRs232Detect
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when a serial port connection is attempted.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAfterRestore
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application after a system restore.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAfterWakeup
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when the device wakes up from standby.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAfterTzChange
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application when the device time-zone is changed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationCommandLine.AppRunAfterExtendedEvent
member.summary: Prefix of the command line when the user requests to run the application after an extended event.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationAction
member.summary: Specifies the action to take when a notification event occurs.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationAction.Led
member.summary: Flashes the LED.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationAction.Vibrate
member.summary: Vibrates the device.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationAction.Dialog
member.summary: Displays the user notification dialog box.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationAction.Sound
member.summary: Plays the sound specified.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationAction.Repeat
member.summary: Repeats the sound for 10–15 seconds.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Notification.NotificationAction.Private
member.summary: Dialog box z-order flag. Set if the notification dialog box should come up behind the password.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer
member.summary: This class encapsulates a low resolution Timer that is designed to be fired on large intervals (from seconds to even days). Unlike the Forms or Threading Timers, if the device is asleep when the Tick occurs, the device will wake and the Tick handler will run.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of a LargeIntervalTimer with a default interval of 60 seconds

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes the LargeIntervalTimer

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.Dispose
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, releases the unmanaged resources used by the LargeIntervalTimer, and optionally releases the managed resources.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.Tick
member.summary: Raised when the LargeIntervalTimer period has elapsed

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.OneShot
member.summary: If set, the Timer will automatically disable itself after each Tick event is raised

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Timer is currently running

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the TimeSpan interval between ticks.
member.remarks: Note that the resolution of the underlying notification timer used is not conducive to millisecond accuracy so any sub-second portion of the Interval is ignored. The Interval also cannot be less than 15 seconds.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.LargeIntervalTimer.FirstEventTime
member.summary: Sets or get the absolute time for the first Tick event. This is useful when setting up a periodic tick starting at a fixed time
member.remarks: The first tick cannot be less than 15 seconds into the future or it will either fire immediately or never fire.
